ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Ummm, Sylly? - or are you replying to me? I ve yet to get a piece of bronze - still in all banded which I bought one piece at a time as I could afford it.
ygData.messageBody:
Ummm, Sylly? - or are you replying to me?

I've yet to get a piece of bronze - still in all banded which I bought one
piece at a time as I could afford it. Don't even WANT bronze, too dang
heavy for little ole woodelf me.

And yeah - the little things are what *I* enjoy - I only bash monsters when
I have to. My motivations and enjoyment is almost the exact opposite of
what Verant obviously thinks folks 'should' be wanting to do.


At 09:15 PM 7/16/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: "FRD" <frd@...>
>
>Be carefull Sylly
>
>You were, and still Are, running around in full bronze plate at way to low
>a level, but since you are such a nice person, I dont mind.
>
>That and Ive seen you many times and you havent gone from 9-30 in 3 weeks.
>you seem to get enjoyment from the little things and I like that....
>
>Jaez
>
>----------
>> From: silky@...
>> To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Twinking
>> Date: Thursday, July 15, 1999 3:28 PM
>>
>> From: silky@...
>>
>>
>>
>> Hehhe, in my original reply - I think something has been misunderstood
>> along the way.
>>
>> I'm not against helping a new character a LITTLE - little patchwork,
>maybe
>> a mino axe (easy and cheap enough to come by) few plat to ease the
>initial
>> startup pain - and knowing an area is a HUGE plus on a second character.
>>
>> I was outraged by lvl 1's in better stuff than I expect to have at lvl
>30,
>> maybe even 40.
>>
>> That's just over the top. Now, if they had this stuff - and banked it for
>a
>> few levels, I wouldn't have NEARLY as much trouble with that.
>>
>> I'm just amazed Verant found a way for it not to matter all that much -
>as
>> I see these guys dead on a regular basis. It's nice to know character
>> development apparently counts for a LOT more than 'stuff', even stuff as
>> nice as that.
